intro: Froesia tricarpa, commonly known as the three-lobed froesia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil. Froesia tricarpa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
